Pre-Game Insights: Australia national football team have won all four of their group games in the Second Round of the 2026 FIFA World Cup Asian Qualifiers.
Australia are yet to concede in the Second Round.
Bangladesh national football team have only managed a point on the table, all thanks to a 1-1 draw against Lebanon. Rest three? All were defeats.
Bangladesh's last game was a 1-0 defeat against Palestine.
Adam Taggart has 17 caps for Australia and has managed to score six goals.
Shekh Morsalin may just be 18 years of age but is a crucial player for Bangladesh.
The hosts led by Javier Cabrera have a fully fit squad to face the might of Australia.
Nestory Irankunda, the 18-year-old winger who is set to join Bayern Munich on July 1, will be one of the fresh faces in the squad.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The visitors have won all four of their group games scoring 15 goals in total
The hosts suffered a 7-0 defeat in the reverse fixture
Australia predicted lineup (4-4-2): Gauci (GK); Strain, Souttar, Circati, Behich; Metcalfe, Baccus, Irvine, Arzani; Yengi, Taggart
Bangladesh predicted lineup (4-3-3): Marma (GK); Ghosh, Barman, S. Hossain, Uddin; Ridoy, Bhuyan, Rana; Morsalin, R. Hossain, Jony
Others: The match will take place at the Bashundhara Kings Arena on June 6.
It will kick off at 4:15 PM IST.
Sports 18 will be broadcasting the match, and it can also be watched for free online on Jio Cinema and Jio TV.
